The restaurant was out of most items (5 out of 7 items we ordered). Getting the Paella took more than an hour despite being almost the only guests. Service was friendly but seemed uninterested.; We came here for dinner with a reservation. We arrived 15 min late (after calling only 5 minutes before our reservation time) and the very nice lady -- who I believe also ended up being our server -- was very accommodating and held our table.  When we arrived we ordered as quickly as we could because the kitchen was closing in 30 minutes. We ordered the Chorizo and Ceviche as our tapas and the Mariscos Paella and Mixta Paella (both personal size). The chorizo was very good, served in oil with cheese and onions (almost reminiscent of a French Onion Soup) and accompanied with pita-like triangles. The paellas we're both delicious and served with half a lobster tail. The lobster was a bit overcooked but the seasoning on the paella was great. And the rice wasn't over cooked, it was more on the al dente side which I prefer (but could see some people complaining about that).

The server was so nice and friendly. We did order a bottle of wine and asked if the guy serving would like to try it with us (it's our favorite wine and we were so excited they had it in stock). He declined with a very polite full response that we understood (though, given it's our favorite wine we would have preferred he enjoyed some too never having had it before). All in all a top notch experience.; Donostia, is such a cute little Espada! The  paella de mariscos is good. My favorite was the pechuga de pollo a la parrilla. This dish was tender, juicy, and seasoned to perfection. The music just makes you want to dance and the sangria is a must!; Good tapas and paella.
